New Records: The Kings truly shot 11.5% (3-26) from the 3-point line tonight.
Key Match Events: Malik Monk injected life into this game with some big “why the hell not” energy.
The Clippers hammered the final nails in by hitting three consecutive 3s in the final two minutes.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored the Lakers to win based on their recent performance.
Post-Match Reflections: The silver lining from tonight is that through nine games so far this season, the Kings remain competitive every night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was just downright bizarre.
It took nearly 90 minutes to get through the first 25 minutes of play.
Scott Foster and his officiating crew made themselves painfully present through a big portion of this game.
Others: The Kings had the easiest 30th strength of schedule going into this game.
The Clippers gave Sacramento opportunities aplenty.
The Kings shot 37/78 FG% if you subtract 3/26 you get 34/52 which is 65.4% (!) on the field goals that are a meager 2 points.
